ACE inhibitors block ACE and ARB block the action of angiotensin II on ATI receptors. Both lead to an increased ACE2 activity.
42 The drugs may alleviate inflammation, decrease endothelial dysfunction and increase insulin sensitivity.
29 The ARBs have more potential to block the RAS than ACEI, as about 40% of angiotensin II is formed via non-ACE pathways in humans.
29 ARBs are known to have less side-effects than ACE inhibitors.
